title: French wine consumption takes a sour downturn
summary: The French are drinking less and less alcohol, especially young people, and especially wine. There are many reasons behind this reality which is putting the industry in difficulty.

title: Gaza health ministry says scores killed during food aid distribution, provoking international outcry
summary: The health ministry of the Hamas-run territory said that over 100 people had died and over 750 injured in Gaza during the distribution of food aid. The ministry called it a 'massacre.'

title: Attacks between Israel, Lebanon's Hezbollah increase fears of uncontrollable escalation
summary: The Party of God has extended its attacks beyond the ten-kilometer border strip, in response to Israeli strikes against targets deep inside Lebanon, as well as in Syria.

title: France maintains its attractiveness to international investors
summary: France welcomed 1,815 foreign investment projects in 2023, led by the United States.

title: Indians are unwittingly recruited into the Russian army
summary: Twenty or so rural workers and unemployed people, who thought they had landed a job in Dubai, were instead sent to fight in Ukraine.

title: TikTokers bank on business of AI-generated true crime deepfakes
summary: Behind the avatars or people created by artificial intelligence that abound on the platform is a race for virality and dubious training course sales.

title: Ex-Canadian PM Brian Mulroney has died
summary: Brian Mulroney, Canada's 18th prime minister, known as one of the architects of the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), passed away on Thursday. He was 84 years old.

title: Putin delivers avalanche of threats, billions and promises ahead of Russia's presidential election
summary: In his address to the nation, the Russian leader once again raised the prospect of a nuclear conflict with the West. Above all, he announced a deluge of promises for the period up to 2030.

title: Macron says Ukraine troop deployment comments were carefully thought out
summary: The French president alarmed several European allies by not ruling out this move. He argued that 'everything that is necessary' must be done to ensure Russia's defeat

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Athletes' Village apartments struggle to find buyers at €7,000 per square meter
summary: Due to high prices in the sector and rising bank rates, buyers have not been rushing to acquire the first properties, which were put on the market in summer 2023.

title: French journalist detained in Ethiopia freed
summary: Antoine Galindo had been detained since February 22 on suspicion of conspiring to create chaos, accusations denounced as baseless by his employer, "Africa Intelligence" magazine.

title: Doctors Without Borders denounces sharp rise in sexual violence against Darien migrants
summary: In just one week in February, the NGO said it had treated 113 people, including nine children, who had been sexually assaulted by criminal groups operating in the lawless Darien Gap. For the whole of January, the number was 120.

title: Award-winning Italian director Paolo Taviani dies at 92
summary: The filmmaker had collaborated with his elder brother on around fifteen feature films, including "Padre Padrone," which won the Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival in 1977.

title: Three Japanese-inspired vegetarian recipes
summary: Japanese curry, creamy corn stew and tofu topped with dashi cream: Prepare for a trip to Japan with these traditional dishes, recreated with a Western twist.

title: Army assault kills Chad opposition leader ahead of election
summary: Yaya Dillo Djerou was set to be the main rival to his cousin and transitional president Mahamat Idriss Deby Itno in the May race.

title: Paris Fashion Week: Dior and Saint Laurent revisit the '60s
summary: Maria Grazia Chiuri delivered graphic dresses and ankle boots, while Anthony Vaccarello displayed pencil skirts and sheer tan blouses. The two designers have delivered opposite visions of the 1960s.

title: French actress Judith Godrèche denounces sexual violence in parliamentary hearing
summary: The actress, who has become a leading figure in France's #MeToo movement after speaking out about sexual violence in the film industry, was the first to have even been heard by the Sénat on these issues.

title: Paul Pogba handed 4-year doping ban
summary: Italy's anti-doping tribunal handed a four-year ban Thursday to France midfielder Paul Pogba after he tested positive for testosterone last year.

title: Madagascar chooses physical castration for child rapists
summary: The country's High Constitutional Court has upheld and, in some aspects, tightened the legislation passed by Parliament. However, the measure is not universally supported by victim advocacy groups.

title: Stellar radiation shapes the disks in which planets are born
summary: Thanks to the James Webb Space Telescope, an international team led by a CNRS researcher has observed that the radiation emitted by exceptionally bright stars causes the gas within a protoplanetary disk to evaporate.

title: US Congress narrowly averts the risk of a budgetary shutdown
summary: Following the House of Representatives on Wednesday, the Senate voted on Thursday for a bill postponing the possibility of a shutdown until March 8.

title: How France's far right switched rhetoric on pesticides
summary: Marine Le Pen's party, which was hostile to the use of agrochemicals until 2021, has since had a radical change in doctrine, becoming a zealous defender of herbicides and neonicotinoid products.

title: North Koreans are used as modern slaves in China's fish processing plants
summary: Journalists from The Outlaw Ocean Project have found that Chinese companies are employing North Koreans, despite UN sanctions. Mostly women, they work in awful conditions and are often sexually assaulted.

title: In Mexico, the Church tries to mediate with drug traffickers to curb violence
summary: In the state of Guerrero, one of the most violent in the country, four bishops met with members of the criminal cartels, who are at war over control of the territory, in hopes of obtaining a truce.

title: Longest-serving mole within the US governement to plead guilty to spying for Cuba
summary: Other Americans arrested for leaking secrets to Havana have included Walter Kendall Myers and Gwendolyn Myers, who were indicted in 2009 on charges of spying for Cuba for nearly 30 years.

title: Paris 2024: How the Olympic Village became a lab for low-carbon construction
summary: The site built in Paris's northern suburbs saw several innovations in the French construction industry.

title: Navalny supporters call for mass presence at his Friday funeral in Moscow
summary: The Russian opposition figure died on February 16 in an Arctic prison colony, in circumstances that remain unclear. A religious ceremony will take place in an Orthodox church in the south of Moscow, under heavy police surveillance.

title: French farmers protest near Paris's Arc de Triomphe, dozens arrested
summary: Police said they had arrested 66 people at a farmers' protest on the Champs-Elysées.

title: Media outlets call for protection of Gaza journalists
summary: More than 30 news organizations signed an open letter expressing solidarity with journalists working in Gaza

title: Macron promises to swim in Seine to show off Olympic cleanup
summary: The Paris mayor Anne Hidalgo also said she would take a dip in the Paris river, which French authorities have spent  €1.4 billion on for upgrades.

title: Ukraine's Western allies already have a military presence in the country
summary: When French President Emmanuel Macron spoke of potentially sending military reinforcements to Ukraine, he unintentionally lifted the veil on the existing presence of Western personnel on Ukrainian soil.

title: Deadly food distribution in Gaza: What we know about the aid convoy and Israeli gunfire
summary: The Gazan health ministry said over 100 people died and over 700 were wounded during a hunger riot in Gaza City, as the Israeli army, which has organized a food shortage in the besieged city, delivered aid.
